top_categories.workout_context: King of the Lake's Lake region, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic King of the Lake's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
54ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
65 miles on german lake region rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
At King of the Lake, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on german lake region rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of King of the Lake. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At King of the Lake, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on german lake region rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on german lake region rolling gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Base fitness for King of the Lake. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for King of the Lake’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at King of the Lake requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on german lake region rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: lake region, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 65 miles of german lake region rolling gravel in Lake Constance, Germany.
